required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of the Shoulder Arthroscopic Surgery on Respiratory Mechanics
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of the Shoulder Arthroscopic Surgery on Respiratory Mechanics

brief_summary.textblock: During shoulder arthroscopic surgery, extravasation of irrigation fluid can occur around the shoulder and trachea, compressing the upper airway. Although the extravasation is generally reabsorbed asymptomatically within 12 hours, there are cases that lead to reintubation or life-threatening complications. Furthermore, the soft tissue edema around the shoulder may extend to the thoracic cage, compress the chest and induce the respiratory distress immediately after surgery. The investigators attempt to determine the effect of shoulder arthroscopic surgery on respiratory mechanics. Changes in respiratory mechanics and arterial blood gases were measured and compared before and after the shoulder arthroscopic surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Currently, most shoulder surgeries are performed with arthroscopy. The advantages of shoulder arthroscopic surgery are decreased blood loss due to minimal incision for scope, a reduced operation time, minimization of surgical stress, and rapid recovery time after surgery. During shoulder arthroscopic surgery, extravasation of irrigation fluid can occur around the shoulder and trachea, compressing the upper airway. Although the extravasation is generally reabsorbed asymptomatically within 12 hours, there are cases that lead to reintubation or life-threatening complications. Furthermore, the soft tissue edema around the shoulder may extend to the thoracic cage, compress the chest and induce the respiratory distress immediately after surgery. From these facts, the mechanism of respiratory discomfort after shoulder arthroscopic surgery may be because the upper airway obstruction or restrictive pathology due to direct compression of thoracic cage by the soft tissue edema. There have been no studies on the respiratory effect of shoulder arthroscopic surgery. We have observed frequent and severe respiratory discomfort after the shoulder arthroscopic surgery. Therefore, in this study we attempt to determine the effect of shoulder arthroscopic surgery on respiratory mechanics. Changes in respiratory mechanics and arterial blood gases were measured and compared before and after the shoulder arthroscopic surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
primary_outcome.description: Static compliance (mL/cmH2O) before and after the arthroscopic surgery ,Static compliance = tidal volume delivered / (plateau pressure - PEEP)

primary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
primary_outcome.description: dynamic compliance (mL/cm H2O) before and after the arthroscpic surgery ,dynamic compliance = tidal volume delivered / (peak pressure - PEEP)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: inspiratory tidal volume (ml) before and after the arthroscpic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: expiratory tidal volume (ml) before and after the arthroscpic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: peak inspiratory pressure (cm H2O) before and after the arthroscpic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: physiologic dead space (VD/VT) before and after arthroscopic surgery ,VD/VT = (PaCO2 - PeCO2)/PaCO2, PeCO2 = mixed expired CO2

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: plateau airway pressure (cmH2O) before and after arthroscopic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Mean airway pressure (cm H2O) before and after arthroscopic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: positive end expiratory pressure (cmH2O) before and after arthroscopic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: inspiratory resistance (cmH2O/L sec) before and after arthroscopic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: expiratory resistance (cmH2O/ L sec)before and after arthroscopic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: peak inspiratory flow (L/min) before and after arthroscopic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: peak expiratory flow (L/min) before and after arthroscopic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Work of breathing (J/L) before and after arthroscopic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: end tidal CO2 (mmHg) before and after arthroscopic surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: arterial oxygen tension (mmHg) measured by arterial blood gas analysis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after arthroscopic surgery, an expected average of 80 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: arterial CO2 tension (mmHg)as measured by arterial blood gas analysis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after general anesthesia, an expected average of 120 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: forced vital capacity measured by portable spirometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after general anesthesia, an expected average of 120 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: forced expiratory volume for 1 second (FEV1)measure by portable spirometry

study_pop.textblock: patients undergoing arthroscopic shoulder rotator cuff repair surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing arthroscopic shoulder rotator cuff repair surgery
- American society of anesthesiologist (ASA) class I or II
- Patients under 70 yrs.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients older than 70 yrs,
- Patients with anatomical derangement of upper airway,
- Patients with pulmonary or cardiac disease,
- Patients with a history of laryngeal or tracheal surgery or hemodynamic instability
